member.name: T:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.TreeList
member.summary: A TreeList is similar to the standard ListView in details mode with the addition of a tree hierarchy and custom content / painting behavior.
member.remarks:
After creating a TreeList add columns using the Add method on the Columns collection:
Column column = new Column("Name", "Item Name", 100, StringAlignment.Center); treeList.Columns.Add(column);
Add rows by setting the RowData property to a collection of objects.
IList<MyClass> items; treeList.RowData = items;
By default, the contents of a cell is determined by calling a property getter on the row object which matches the column id (via reflection). For example, if the the control RowData property is set to an array of ActivityInfo objects, a column with an id of "EndTime" will return the value of the activityInfo.EndTime property.
To display the text of the cell ToString() is called on any object which is returned from a getter method that is not a string type. Since this usually doesn't format data the way you want to show it to the user, there are two options:
1) Create a UI wrapper object which contains the true data object for each row. The wrapper object implements a get method returning a string that calls the method on the contained data object and formats it. Continuing the example above, we would create a new property EndDateText which is implemented something like return activityInfo.EndTime.ToLocalTime().ToShortDateString()
2) Set the LabelProvider property to an implementation class which derives from DefaultContentProvider and returns the appropriate text for each column. This would typically involve downcasting the element parameter of the GetText method to a known concrete type which is contained in the RowData (such as ActivityInfo), switching on column.Id and returning the customized text. For any columns that don't need special formatting, use the base class GetText method which will call the property getter based on the column id.

member.name: T:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Fitness.IExtendMapTileProviders
member.summary: Provide an extension to the available map tile providers. Each map tile provider returned from the MapTileProviders method will be listed in the map selection for the routes control.

member.name: P:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Fitness.IExtendMapTileProviders.MapTileProviders
member.summary:
Return a list of IMapTileProvider instances. This method will be called every time the list of maps needs to be displayed; for performance reasons a singleton instance of each provider should be created once (or a singleton of a map tile provider list manager).
Because this is called each time the map list is displayed, the plugin may change the list of map tile providers available while the application is running, making certain providers unavailable based on user preferences or availability of remote servers.

The maximum width.
The maximum height.
A border style.
Whether to include a border margin or not.

member.name: P:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.ImageSelector.ReadOnly
member.summary: Get or set whether the control is read only. A read-only control is different from a disabled control in that the image cannot be modified (pasted, selected, dopped to), but the user can still click the image to see the source image. It is preferrable to set a ImageSelector to ReadOnly instead of diabled.

member.name: P:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.ImageSelector.ImageLocation
member.summary: Set the local path (C:\folder\image.png) of the image or url (http://).

member.name: P:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.ImageSelector.ImageSelectLocation
member.summary: Set the actual location of the image (the source, not the cache location).

member.name: P:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.ImageSelector.Image
member.summary: Retrieve the displayed image. If the image is not set null will be returned. If an error occurred loading the image the error icon will be returned.

member.name: P:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.ImageSelector.MaximumImageSize
member.summary: Set the maximum size of the image in memory. Images larger than the size will be resized in whole increments of the source image until it fixs the maximum size. For example if the maximum size is 200 pixels and the source image is 350 pixels, the resulting image size will be 175 pixels. The default size is 200 by 200, pass in Size.Empty for unlimited.

For example, a MenuPath of {"Power", "Calculate"} with a Title of "Training Load" under the "Analyze" menu would result in a popup menu under "Analyze" called "Power", with a popup menu "Calculate" with menu item "Training Load"

member.name: T:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Mapping.IMapTileProvider
member.summary:
A map provider is a stateless object which renders map images inside the route control when requested. Typically the map provider will render images when the DrawMap method is called. If the map provider is rendering data from a remote server and the download of data should be queued and that section of the map not drawn immediately. When the data is downloaded the map provider can notify the control to invalidate the region with the downloaded info. In this manner we support tiled map images coming from servers (such as terraserver) that download incrementally.
The map provider controls the zoom level (magnification) by the minimum and maximum ranges. When zooming the map control will increment/decrement the zoom by 1 or 0.25 if fractional zooming is supported. By chosing an appropriate level of zoom and returning false for fractional zooming, the map provider can ensure that an integer zoom is used which may correspond to a different map image tile-set at different magnification level. Each level of zoom should be a power of 2 farther away. For example: zoom level 1 = 10 meters per pixel zoom level 2 = 20 meters per pixel zoom level 3 = 40 meters per pixel zoom level 4 = 80 meters per pixel ...etc...
More importantly the map provider controls the projection system which maps GPS coordinates to pixels.
Because the instance does not hold any state based on the route control (location, zoom, etc) a single map provider can (and should) service multiple controls. Typically a plugin will create a single map provider instance for each type of provider the plugin supports. This presents and interesting problem for caching since requests for images may come in for different GPS locations at different levels of zoom in unpredictable order.
See also IExtendMapProviders

member.name: M:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Mapping.IMapTileProvider.DrawMap(ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Mapping.IMapImageReadyListener,System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle,ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Data.GPS.IGPSLocation,System.Double)
member.summary: Draw the map. Any map images which are immediately available (e.g. cached on disk) should be drawn immediately. For missing map images, queue them for download and return the number missing.
member.param: A listener to notify for asynchronous fetching of map images (from a server).
A graphics context to draw on.
The rectangle to draw the map at.
The clipping rectangle for drawing optimization.
The GPS location at the center of the drawRectangle (width/2,height/2).
The current zoom level.
member.returns: Number of missing map images which were queued for download.

member.name: M:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Mapping.IMapTileProvider.Refresh(System.Drawing.Rectangle,ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Data.GPS.IGPSLocation,System.Double)
member.summary: Refresh the map area by discarding any cached map images. After this call the control will be invalidated which will cause the appropriate calls to be made to refetch any images from the server.
member.param: The rectangle to draw the map at.
The GPS location at the center of the drawRectangle (width/2,height/2).
The current zoom level.

member.summary: Return the read-only list of selected time ranges, or null if there are no selected ranges. The ranges must appear in increasing order and must not overlap, so the ValueRangeSeries class can be used to construct this. member.name: P:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Fitness.IFileImporter.FileExtension
member.summary: Return the file extension which applies to this import source. Returning a non-null value from this property will add the extension to the list of files available in the import list when the user browses the file system. Do not include the leading period. eg "hst", not ".hst"

member.name: T:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Fitness.IFitnessDevice
member.summary: A GPS device which can be used to import/export information from.

member.name: M:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Fitness.IFitnessDevice.ConfiguredDescription(System.String)
member.summary: Return the textual description based on the configuration info. Up to two lines of info may be separated by Environment.Newline. Typically the info will include the Name on the first line, and a description of the configuration on the second line, eg: Garmin - Forerunner 201 COM 3

member.name: M:ZoneFiveSoftware.Common.Visuals.Fitness.IFitnessDevice.Configure(System.String)
member.summary: Open a dialog to prompt the user for device configuration (such as COM port) and return the new configuration string. If the source has not been configured null will be passed into the configurationInfo parameter. If null is returned, the configuration failed or was cancelled. This will be called the first time a device is selected and whenever the user clicks the device configuration button.
